guide.title: Gentoo Managers' Meeting Summary
guide.subtitle: 23 Feb. 2004
guide.author: Grant Goodyear
guide.abstract: This meeting began at 1930 UTC, and the guest chair was Grant Goodyear. There were no scheduled agenda items other than the usual open-floor developer discussion.

body.p:
On the eve of the 2004.0 release the major topic of discussion was the release process. The discussion wandered from how many releases we should have per year, to what our release candidates should be, to what distinguishes a release from a random emerge -u world, and to the ubiquitous issue of quality control. Minor topics included reverse dependencies (wait for portage-ng) and removal of unused dependencies (emerge depclean, but be careful!). The meeting adjourned at 2028 UTC. See the raw
log for additional details.
